doc.after: Writing may refer to two activities the inscribing of characters on a medium with the intention of forming words and other lingual constructs that represent language and record information or the creation of information to be conveyed through written language There are some exceptions for example the use of a typewriter to record information is generally called typing rather than writing Writing refers to both activities equally and often both activities occur simultaneously however one may write while doing only one of the activities
